entry.def: If you provoke someone, you deliberately annoy them and try to make them behave aggressively.

example.ex: He started beating me when I was about fifteen but I didn't do anything to provoke him...
example.tran: 在我快15岁时他开始打我，可我并没有任何招惹他的举动。

example.ex: I provoked him into doing something really stupid.
example.tran: 在我的刺激下他做了件非常愚蠢的事。

entry.def: If something provokes a reaction, it causes it.

example.ex: His election success has provoked a shocked reaction...
example.tran: 他的当选引起一片震惊。

example.ex: The destruction of the mosque has provoked anger throughout the Muslim world.
example.tran: 毁坏清真寺的行为激怒了整个伊斯兰世界。

means.word_mean: 1. causing or tending to cause anger or resentment;
